Photo of Condado Tacos - Lawrenceville - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. All the dips that came with the nachos.

rmujmC39RvQQdiCEXWHkjA.text: We came on a Wednesday night to check out the spot. It's an interesting vibe with large communal like tables. We were seated downstairs where it was quieter, but had a TV playing Jeopardy....  We ordered drinks, with only one local craft available on draft (two others were out). Our waitress suggested the queso of the month dip, buffalo chicken. We ordered those as we look over the taco options. The waitress recommended 2-3 per person.  So, here's what we ordered and thoughts: El Tradicional - Both hubs and I got this one. It was certainly more authentic than the others and the chorizo was tasty. Downside is that it is messy to eat and the seasoning linger on your hands all night, no matter how much you wash your hands.  Dutch Dragon - Hubs ordered this and it was his favorite. The portobello gave it a heartier taste. I took a bite and thought The Mantis was way better, partly because I don't care for corn salsa (preference thing).   The Mantis - My favorite! I love the heat from the mango habanero sauce, which worked well with the jackfruit. The Lucy shell had a soft spice and crispiness to it. Definitely not authentic, but a good fusion of flavors.  El Santo - Our least favorite. I was intrigued by the Condado Secret Sauce in the description. We didn't taste it. It was such a basic taco, so bland and lack of creativity compared to the others. Pass.  Queso of the month: buffalo chicken: Rich and tasted like buffalo chicken. It's a sizable portion. We probably ate half before the tacos arrived and that was too much. Hubs regretted ordering 3 tacos. I was wise in ordering 2.  It's an okay spot if you're in the area and want to hang out with friends. I can totally get that vibe--grab some drinks, some chips, and maybe a taco or two.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Lawrenceville - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Taco Wednesday!

67GxNYfFrFi0gctbZcfr2w.text: I'm thrilled there's a second location for Condado now! I most frequently come for their happy hours, which is half off margs, including their flavored ones, and a dollar off tacos. I love their muddled jalapeno margarita - having sipped some of my pals' flavored margs, I think the jalapeno meshes the best with the tequila without being overly sweet like some of the fruity ones. I haven't had a bad taco here yet, but am still trying to figure out which one reigns ~supreme~. Probably one with their double soft-hard shells.   I like that condado isn't really trying for authentic Mexican, bc lbr that's hard to come by this far east, but just tasty food. Veg friendly too!

CqJetd6hh6QVVLq0cFR84Q.text: I love that Condado opened this location in addition to the one downtown! The food is just as good here, with cool artwork on the walls that is uniquely Lawrenceville. Even when it's busy, the food comes out quickly and the waiters are attentive. It can be a bit tight when it's busy, since they'll seat multiple parties at the same table to avoid a wait, but it isn't really an issue.   Condado's monthly specials are always interesting and include a new drink, guac, queso, and taco. I like the options to either make your own tacos or order some of their suggestions--there's definitely something for every taste! Their tacos are stuffed to the brim, unlike some of the other popular (and more expensive) taco places in Pittsburgh. They have plenty of vegan and vegetarian options, which I appreciate. Their margaritas are also always good, not too sweet but flavorful. The best part of Condado is how affordable everything is! We got 5 tacos total, chips and a huge bowl of guac, and two margaritas for $30. We left feeling happy and a bit too full!

J43OGvP8gbLI5scRKcxmOQ.text: Finally I've made it to this location! Woohoo for me!  I'll start off by saying the decor is one of my most fave things and I'm not biased because the artwork was done by my pal Matt Spahr. Seriously he's so talented.  Everything is pretty much fun the same as it is downtown but the layout here makes it feel more roomy, even if it may not be.  Staff is friendly and accommodating.  I stick with what I know: build your own tacos. Can't go wrong.  The tacos always come out as ordered and in a timely manner.

stnrPBHEVKOxPo0-rP8hcA.text: HOLY TACOS! This place is my new favorite taco spot in town (new to me)! We stopped in after a tiresome day of bowling at Arsenal to refuel, and were pleasantly surprised by the fun decor and tasty food! Plus, they only had two items with gluten that I need to avoid which is a HUGE plus for me!  We started with their chips and queso before realizing that they had tons of different queso options! Next time we hope to try the broccoli and cheese queso. Then we each ordered two tacos which were out in record time and very filling! We sat at the bar, but the rest of the place is set up with community style tables.   They have a very extensive selection to make your own tacos or you can choose from some of their most popular selections! In my opinion, you can't go wrong, but be sure to check out their taco, queso and marg of the month!

3AYW7KgvEwIdslyogHF4Jg.text: 3 stars because no other option than tacos  Happy hour 1/2 off tacos & margaritas ... I ate and drank for ~$20.  The blackerry margarita (which is served over ice in a short mason jar) was delicious.  So similar to Burgatory, a handful of "pre-built" tacos or build your own.  If you have issues with spicy food, either pre-medicate or skip this restaurant.  My mouth and belly were on fire.   I started with 2 shrimp "pre-built" tacos and ventured out to a build your own.  Leave it to the experts, their taco was better than mine.  Ample parking next door in an open lot.  The main floor is LOUD.  The typical Pittsburgh basement is cool and quieter EXCEPT when a PAT bus blocks the basement window and the area darkens quickly.  Give it a try.

y4FQOqBiwae7jt67bwD-hw.text: This place has the most amazing tacos, queso, and guac that I've ever had!!! We typically choose Mexican style restaurants or food spots because we love that type of stuff and we were definitely impressed with Condado Tacos. Such a friendly vibe, with awesome art all around.  We will most definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Lawrenceville - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

M7TJofkEqE9S827CtdQ_OQ.text: On a recent Thursday night, I decided last-minute to check out the new location of the infamous Condado Tacos. I figured I'd save myself a table given the time I was visiting, so I logged onto my Yelp app and checked myself into their line. I got a message that it would be a five to ten minute wait, and there were three parties ahead of me. Cool; no problem here, right?  Well imagine my shock when I arrived and was told Condado Tacos doesn't use Yelp and NoWait to reserve spots. Something about how the business owners activated the service on the Yelp page but the staff don't have access to it. Um...WHAT? No. Unacceptable. There are hundreds of businesses in this city that don't Falsely advertise a line service to their customers. There is no reason for Condado Tacos to do this. If anyone from Condado Tacos management reads this, please either disable NoWait on your page or give your staff the tools they need to utilize it.  Anyway. I ended up sitting at the bar since it was the only place where there was (barely) room for me. Not exactly ideal, given the time of year - but I managed to roll my winter coat up to fit into my lap, as well as safely tuck my computer bag under my feet on the floor.   The bartender, to his credit, was very nice. And I soon had a margarita in hand while waiting on a couple made-to-order custom tacos featuring my shells, proteins, and toppings of choice. Think Burgatory, but with tacos instead of burgers - and I think that's the real appeal of this place. I had noticed Condado Tacos does have a "standard" menu as well, but hey, why not take advantage of a custom option when it's available?  While waiting, I was able to look around the restaurant a little. The decor is wild - we're talking bright glowing murals surrounding a bar backlit by appealing and calming blue lights. It's a very cool looking place, I'll give them that. But the music was just too. Dang. Loud! Combined with the chatter of a full restaurant and bar, and I couldn't really hear myself think while I was here.  Anyway, I didn't look around long because the tacos arrived pretty quickly. And they were...OK. Not bad at all, but for all the hype I've heard about Condado Tacos this year, I think I expected more in the seasoning and flavor department. I guess the low prices and ability to order exactly what you want are ultimately what people like here. And the quick service was impressive given how busy the place was.  Still, I'm not sure I'll be back to Condado Tacos. The place is too small and too loud for my liking, and while the custom menu option is cool the tacos didn't "wow" me as expected. It's an OK place though, and I could be persuaded to return in the right circumstances.

hGzD1s00l4kTpn1puCUBmw.text: Just as good as the one downtown. Love that they are on the no wait app as well!! Honestly one of the best happy hours in Pittsburgh!!  We had the quac, queso, and salsa. Good portion for the price. The margaritas were strong, and steak tacos in the juju shells were amazing. Cooled them off with some pineapple salsa.   I dream about eating this food no joke!!! Have never been disappointed! Great value and quality for the price!!

cqY3Vlgmdp9d00JTjFwnkQ.text: Happy hour was amazing. Margaritas are so good, so we're the tacos. The place had a great vibe as well.

qvJ0vb7vx4Ais2TbRxp7Hw.text: Last week on a hum bug, me and my best friend went here. It popped up in my yelp notifications as "hot & new" so we decided to give it a go. It happened to be Halloween and happy hour, which was perfect for us. The atmosphere was VERY welcoming, and place was packed (in a great way)! The hostess was friendly and seated us right away. We got sat next to a couple who was finishing up and they gave us their remaining gift card which had $15 left on it! (SCORE) anyways, the special for happy hour was 1/2 margaritas and $1 off tocos. Let me say... the margaritas were amazing!! They aren't blended with ice, but rather severed over ice in mason jars (another PLUS) and the selection of choices was amazing! After we placed our drink orders we began building our tocos (their menu is set up like Burgatory) and the options to create your own tocos are endless. The service was fast despite how busy it was, and everything was FRESH! Our waitress was super friendly and very helpful & knowledgeable. After we finished our tocos, we sat and finished our drinks. My best friend lives in North Carolina now & is talking about flying back just for this place & their tocos!

8liIsmpV5QuS7aYfFHDQqg.text: The vegan tacos were really good! The Double dutch taco was very flavorful and spicy. Didn't get why it needs two tortillas though. I was soooo happy when they had an Impossible taco as taco of the month. It was soo good. I had it without the cheddar cheese, if they had had a vegan cheese sub it would've been the ultimate "meaty" vegan taco. The Impossible patty was crispy, such a good texture! Deff recommend.

Ew9zpBodX9lNOtwwTxDVcA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! This is my second visit to this location, along with visiting the downtown location once. Gets better every time! My family started out by ordering the pico de guaco which came with salsa and we all loved it! For our meal, we all made our own tacos off of the check list at the table which makes it so much easier to make sure you'll like what you order. Ive had their chicken every time and it is the BEST! I would 10000% recommend this place and will definitely continue coming back every time I'm home!

VuNboz4BjI-lfrpmCthryw.text: I know I'm the odd one out here. Everyone I know loves Condado. Their margaritas are are too sweet and syrupy tasting to me. The do it yourself taco idea is a cool idea in theory, but it can be a little overwhelming. I do enjoy their list of "predecided" tacos. I usually pick one off of there but even those ones are just okay. I would recommend going during happy hour.

I-H5kW1RyVhgqOytBbDXqg.text: The vegan tacos r the bomb but the atmosphere is lacking. Not handicap accessible. Most seating is communal, high bar stools

GUL4V4XptJpcY5sKsaRJPg.text: Good place, good food, clean, and mostly consistent hours. Although whiskey and tequila selection is great at the other store, selection and perhaps a fair variety of those here, this location has a small beer tap selection that they don't keep properly stocked, and it's worse for their cans/bottles. Also, no WiFi available for customers, unlike the store down on Liberty downtown used to have (may still have?). The music is mostly solid at this location, and fits the theme/format (downtown location can be tough to visit because one bartender likes to commandeer the playlist to off-theme/format hip-hoppy pop--painful), but some staff will come out blaring portable speaker music players (loud) to drown out the ordinary store music well BEFORE closing time (and the store will feel closed as early as 1:30 a.m., perhaps with most of the lights out--little says "get the hell out of here" more than that). I've been to this store a fair number of times, and want to come back, but this last time I was hustled to close out my tab perhaps an hour before I was ready to do so--all for server convenience (I can understand a server wanting to close out, but there has to be a way to credit servers by custody of the table, net of tips and all--not hard to program). Why should a customer be harassed over more than one transaction and have to lose the table service they bargained for? Also, how long must one wait at the front of the house to be seated while the host watches television? This place may be slipping fast.

QoAUoFtbwcZbBb6bgGfiiQ.text: Tacos were a little soggy and not as hot as I'd have liked. But the price was right and I love the ability to customize and the big selection.

4KIIOH0ka9VSdmUsazUizA.text: This has been a great weekend. A friend recommended Condado Tacos to me and I have to say probably the best taco joint I've ever been to. First off, really nice service. Great people who are personable and friendly. The queso appetizers are incredible. A real must-- especially the one with corn. Also this place uses the papers with check marks as well. I haven't told a waiter or waitress what I wanted to eat in days! I did the build your own tacos and I got three which I really recommend. Great food, great atmosphere, great service. The only thing I didn't care for was at first they tried to seat us at a long table between two parties. Wouldn't have had much room so I recommend sitting at the bar. But I'm sure they hear that all the time.

Ls_ArKKJ5ysc-RAVrHDY5Q.text: I'd give the food 4 stars but the music is so incredibly loud that it prevents me from enjoying this place.  We went with friends on a Friday the week they opened.  The place was incredible crowded and we waited about 20 minutes for a table.  We noticed the volume of the music was inordinately loud and we basically had to shout our conversation.  But the food was delicious.  A month or two goes by and my wife and I are looking for a place in the neighborhood for a quick bite on a Tuesday night.  We literally walked in and heard the loud music and immediately walked out and over to another place on Butler.  We're not senior citizens that hate loud music but I don't know if we will be back until this place becomes less like a nightclub and more like a restaurant, especially with so many other options in close proximity.

gl9NY5hSQ9CTon-D9hn-2w.text: The manager and waitstaff were wonderful when my large group of friends came for dinner. We had a bit of a wait (which was expected for 19 people on a Saturday) but the staff were all so pleasant and efficient. Don't get me wrong, the food was amazing too but the service was just wonderful. Get the queso blanco and the blood orange margarita for sure!

nu8CHyROQYAaFaTuNP7UXA.text: Delicious! Friendly! A coworker and I stopped for lunch today.  The environment is friendly and artistic.  Our server was friendly and helpful.   The food was perfect.  You complete a sheet at the table full of options to build your own taco or you can pick a pre-made piece.  The queso was dead on with the added chorizo.   We received our food quickly and it was correct the first time.  I would go back in a heartbeat.  I highly recommend you check it out next time your in Lawrenceville.

8liIIBYsHlWRvdJr-nPN_Q.text: Awesome tacos, even better margaritas. It's the burgatory if tacos with the build it yourself menu

poW5vhJJgRlbSu_Cj55qrA.text: This place is incredibly loud.  When I arrived, I asked the hostess if she could seat me in a room that was less noisy, she told me the the other rooms were closed.  I looked later and they were definitely open.  My ears still hurt the next morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Lawrenceville - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. It is extremely loud.

AvkhyHvv1alXQNnHKkKUow.text: Amazing! What a great new addition to butler street. Very nice happy hour with half off yummy house margaritas and $1 off tacos. Tacos are delicious and a good portion. Really enjoyed our time there.

2hFJph4zzibvQ7-MDPGZ5w.text: Awesome food great service cool space. Food came quickly and was amazing - chips and salsa was also yummy. definitely worth the ride. Can't wait to come back!

CE_0lfLinriI-xiPjIAjbw.text: Wide tequila selection. Little more than a few drafts including a unique collaboration that at least at the moment is fantastic (New England style prickly pear IPA). Awesome tacos, 2 were enough for me but possibly could've stuffed myself with 3. Fun music (rock/metal), fun environment (colorful), and a couple TVs above the bar for catching the Steelers or Pens game. I'll be back.

WldxEmKViJqlU-dk-_7Ncw.text: I live a couple blocks away and eat here all the time. Since opening, I've probably gotten food here over ten times.   Pros: High quality food - I've enjoyed everything I've eaten from Condado. Lots of variety for vegetarians and new seasonal items each month Cheap prices- You can get a full meal for under $10 Great service - Everyone that works there (bartenders, servers, hosts, food runners) has a great attitude and actually seem like they enjoy their job. Everything comes out quick and with a smile Rewards program - 10% cash back deal when you sign up. Great stuff  Cons: Literally nothing.   I feel like this review sounds like I work there or own the place but I really don't. I live off 47th in Lawrenceville and couldn't be happier that the perfect restaurant opened in my neighborhood. I will take all out of town visitors to Condado. Keep up the good work!

Y6uakUFJ70rQqq6VECnT1A.text: I would definitely recommend coming to this if you want some interesting tacos. If you come here, I would also recommend the queso and salsa. The queso was awesome and very tasty. All of the food came out very quick, which I was very impressed with. We loved that they refreshed our chips throughout the night. The reason why I wouldn't rate this a 5 is because you make your own tacos. They do have recommendations for quick tacos, but none of us were interested in many of these tacos. One of the tacos that I made was really good, but the second one was mediocre. I would have liked more guidance in regards to good pairings. Additionally, some of the tacos were very greasy and a mess to eat.   Best drink: blood orange margarita

KlCO6QBMf2XdugSpIKaPBA.text: This was my first time coming here and i'll definitely be back! Food was amazing, chips and salsa is awesome, and the service is great as well. I would highly recommend coming here!

9SUuhOgG4V7o9PwBNZVGkg.text: This place has the best tacos in Pittsburgh. The amount of choices for shell, protein, toppings, and sauces is amazing. The price isn't bad either.

IIc0-7PoE_fN9cMBg0iMFw.text: Margheritas acidic, food terrible. For a place that has 4 stars, it's awful. The salsa's, are flavorless. Our meal was a huge disappointment for a Mexican restaurant. Service very scarce, but the bartenders were awesome!  Not worth the money

b6r8PQOH_HtBQHP2deBt4w.text: Taste like A bunch of Indian spices, the only option for tacos are hard shells or flour, there's zero authenticity to their "Mexican" dishes. The only part that wasn't bad was the waitress. They should clarify that it isn't authentic Mexican tacos, it's like a Taco Bell for hipsters honestly but somehow mixed with Indian food ? I don't get it.

_Ld9Rl4MW9HR_Fc_sKDFlg.text: Great decoration and atmosphere. I was excited because I like the one downtown alot. I missed happy hour which was from 5 to 7 in the bar area. But I didn't feel like drinking maragrita. I got the surf and turf taco which is my favorite because of the ghost pepper sauce, also got the guacamole because they give you sooooo much for a great price!

photos.caption: Photo of Condado Tacos - Lawrenceville - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beers and guac!

ALcc5HtDHzFv_WnPJdk90w.text: Good margaritas, good chips and dip, fast service. Tacos weren't as good as everybody hyped them up to be. Staff was very young and constantly on their phones.

vkaWibfXQzE-MlIW_CZISg.text: Wow! The food the Art and just the overall feel is great.  The crew is well trained and fun!  Prices are surprisingly reasonable.   A must visit when you are in the area

Dw-GuRpvw9_PoMfS88ly4g.text: Delicioso! The margs & the tacos here are delish! And happy hour is 1/2 price margs and $1 off tacos 5-7pm M-F. We had an amazing bartender for pre-dinner cocktails and an equally amazing server for dinner. Prompt, attentive, friendly and knowledgeable/ the staff here is friendly and courteous. We had dinner in the sun-ground basement. It's cheerful, busy and colorful so you forget you're not above ground. The ofrendo del mezcal margarita is smokey, sweet and spicy all at the same time and is perhaps one of the best margaritas Ive ever had. The tacos are prepared equally as deliciously the cocktails. Great lively ambiance. If you're looking for quiet and romantic - this isn't the place... this is a fun Friday night with friends or a night with your partner.

uNUyt9w5EdIPeMp480xt0Q.text: I constantly dream about the food here! Hands down best tacos/nachos I've had. Doesn't hurt that you can custom order both! The two options- custom or chef created- make for a perfect meal either way. My hubby likes the chef created tacos. Every new taco he bites into he says, "oh my, you HAVE to try this." Amazing each bite! I'm more of a nachos fan, and I appreciate that options available for topping. Everything all the way down to the tortilla chip is amazing. Also, their dips are phenomenal, too. I highly recommend their guacamole- those pickles onions are everything!- and their chorizo queso. Our last visit we opted for the queso blanco, and I found myself missing the spice of the chorizo. It was still delicious though! Can't wait to go back!!

b0fEQtURIpRyCcJif3eLtQ.text: I sat on posting this for a while, but the other night when I walked in this past Friday, there wasn't a change. The bar staff I encountered was rude and not attentive. I by no means want the server in my face, but she could use an attitude alignment. Great that Condado is expanding, but the service should come with that never had anyone rude to be at the downtown location even when they are slammed pack. My food was okay, and I don't think this place has the most fantastic tacos, but if I wrote in on my sheet I want it, and I was missing things off my tacos.

fpGF_r36tGgaUxC-C1VRYQ.text: Very artsy contemporary vibe which I am a fan of. Food was pretty good and it's located in a ever so growing Lawrenceville.

G4K9XCVuVvaZeOqAaU3lsw.text: It sucks to leave a bad review but have to break it down. Tacos were really bad and cold. You would have more luck and money well spent at Taco Bell. Service overall not the best. Forgot my drink and unapologetic. Kinda my pet peev when people do that. Guacamole can be found in the supermarket. Low quality ingredients. I asked to make the guacamole spicy and got charged for pickled jalapenos. If I knew there were no fresh jalapenos, I would never eat there in the first place. It's a red flag. In addition there is no instructions on how to order the tacos if you are a first timer. I think that is on the server though. Overall everything was bad and I felt the place was dirty. It was unfortunate as it was my fiancee birthday that day.

raAhstt1mTx_zERkwU4djQ.text: If you like Tacos and an awesome atmosphere. Condado's is the only place to go. Been here since November and I can't count how many times I have had Tacos for breakfast. The bartenders are the best. I'm headed to a new town and will miss you guys.  Thanks James from Texas

kUd4OGP2NQ3Tqn7dGbcUcw.text: Great spot good food. A couple tacos and beers turned into a 60 dollar bill with tip which seems high even for the hipster environment of Lawrenceville but all in all it's a good spot and I'd visit again.

1acD19pCfj2scuCietoUtA.text: Ever wondered what a taco spot would be like if investors googled what was hot with youth culture then built a restaurant off the first 5 results? Well, you get the idea. The food is passable but the service was terrible. At best we were an after thought for staff and had to sit and listen to deafening music while we waited on our food. As I mentioned, the food is passable but not great. It could be compared to overpriced Taco Bell. On the plus side they serve food until late, so there is that.

tfJIcxhMjoRYhygQa_7i5g.text: There is no such thing as too much condado. This is our favorite place for tacos for so many reasons. The food is great and delicious. You can customize to build whatever tacos you want. I am a fan of the Juicy Lucy taco shell with pulled pork and pineapple salsa. And the prices are just right, especially for the portions. These aren't wimpy tacos. They are the real deal! We also love their dirty queso and that they have guacamole specials that add unique mix-ins and toppings that unexpectedly just work so well together.

uFfF-zJW5Ebmlzm4i5DvrA.text: Great atmosphere. I've been to the one downtown but the lawrenceville spot was so much better. My tacos were made correctly and full of flavor!! Wish I could say the same about the downtown location.

AFUWmPBlS4uFnQfOQzXEew.text: I've been to both of Condado taco's pittsburgh locations. As an avid fan of ethnic cusine with a special affinity for tacos I really and truly want to like this place. I mean I kind of do in theory, completely customizable tacos, queso dips, guac, and nachos. A cool and inventive menu even offering vegetarian and vegan options, who could beat that?? But everytime I go I am unfortunately underwhelmed, I don't know if I'm always choosing incompatible flavor combinations or if I just really and truly don't like the taste of Condado's food. And after three different tries at two separate locations, I'm leaning toward the latter. Customer service is usually not bad here, but the set up of the restaurant/bars are a little funky in my opinion. All in all not a bad restaurant, but definitely not my favorite place to get a taco.

LUO1_gWqxc9wXhiZnkpwaQ.text: Busy and brightly decorated. Lots of combinations for tacos. Definitely worth checking out. Service was prompt and our server kept tabs on us. Friendly staff. Fun atmosphere but very loud and tightly packed when busy. Great for a casual dinner when you want quick service.

Y8i9-0XfdrGGZ_OVvv3VUQ.text: If I wrote this review based solely on the food, I would give Condado Lawrenceville higher marks. Everything was great! Tasty food, reasonably priced and good service. However, this is just part of the equation in this case. I like a place with ambiance and this place just doesn't have the right vibe - at least for what I'm looking for in a dining experience. They squeezed way too many people into the space. The music they played was unrecognizable. It was too loud and just awful - and I like all kinds of music. And most of all, what they did to the beautiful space that was Tender is just criminal. If none of this matters to you, by all means go here because the food is good. But if you want a more chill place where you can have conversation, this might not be that place.

uHd9c8jukcdUB91dSIyt7A.text: TAKE MY MONEY! I am obsessed with Condado and feel lucky to live within walking distance. The food is affordable and delicious. I wish it was a little quieter and I don't love sharing my table with strangers. However, sitting in the back room or downstairs is quieter and I do a lot of take out. Friendly servers. Keep it up.

hWjZvnWvhFKKGJa47aCLSw.text: This place is rotten! Went there on a Sunday night at 7. Sat for 25 minutes while we were ignored by the waiters and then saw a fight about who was assigned to our section. Finally got waters and ordered. Food was cold and they never came back by. Had to go to the bar to ask for refills on water. We also had drinks, but they never came back by to see if we want another. On top of all that, the place if filthy. There is a layer of grim on the tables and floors. Do not go.
